Key Arguments: The legislation threatens free speech and could harm Australians by silencing them.
The government has a history of incorrectly defining 'misinformation', as demonstrated during the Covid-19 pandemic.
Censorship based on government-defined misinformation can lead to incorrect suppression of valid information.
Notable Quotes: The draft exposure says it is about keeping ans safe from 'harm'. But the government will cause harm by silencing Australians!
The recent history of the government attempting to define what is 'misinformation' should cause grave concerns about this bill.
This one example shows why giving the government even more power is a recipe for disaster.
